description: Wire a complete 20-amp circuit from the electrical panel to an outlet box following NEC code requirements

steps.description: Select the correct wire gauge for a 20A circuit
steps.hintText: A 20A circuit requires 12 AWG wire minimum per NEC Table 310.16. Look for the wire spool labeled 12 AWG.

steps.description: Route the wire from the electrical panel to the outlet box
steps.hintText: Pick up the wire and route it from the panel area to the outlet box. Keep the wire run neat and direct.

steps.description: Strip the insulation from the wire ends (approximately 3/4 inch)
steps.hintText: Pick up the wire strippers and use them on both ends of each conductor to remove insulation. Expose about 3/4 inch of bare wire.

steps.description: Connect the hot (black) wire to the 20A breaker terminal
steps.hintText: Take the black (hot) wire end and connect it to the screw terminal on the 20A breaker. Only one wire per terminal (NEC 408.41).

steps.description: Connect the neutral (white) wire to the neutral bus bar
steps.hintText: Connect the white (neutral) wire to an open terminal on the neutral bus bar (silver-colored bar).

steps.description: Connect the ground (bare/green) wire to the ground bus bar
steps.hintText: Connect the bare copper or green ground wire to an open terminal on the ground bus bar.

steps.description: Connect all three wires to the outlet receptacle terminals
steps.hintText: At the outlet: black wire goes to brass screw (hot), white wire to silver screw (neutral), ground wire to green screw.

steps.description: Secure the breaker into the panel by pressing it onto the bus bar
steps.hintText: Press the breaker firmly into an open panel slot until it clicks onto the bus bar.

steps.description: Label the circuit in the panel directory
steps.hintText: Write the circuit description on the panel directory next to the breaker number. Example: 'Kitchen Outlets - 20A' (NEC 408.4).
